snippet: Queen Elizabeth II broke with her custom of performing no public duties on the anniversary of the death of her father, King George VI, in 1952.
abstract: Queen Elizabeth II breaks with her custom of performing no public duties on the anniversary of the death of her father, King George VI, in 1952, by making brief appearances at a town hall and a village nursery school.
lead_paragraph: Queen Elizabeth II broke with her custom of performing no public duties on the anniversary of the death of her father, King George VI, in 1952.

headline.seo: Britain: Quiet Anniversary for Queen Elizabeth II
headline.main: Britain: Quiet Anniversary for a Queen
